CatDescriptText: Mrs. William Cruse, housewife, Greensburg, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 19, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that cab drivers in general take advantage of other motorists and pedestrians in traffic? As a group, would you call them courteous or discourteous?" answer reads: "I speak only of the Greensburg cab drivers.  The majority are courteous, but some do take advantage of motorists and pedestrians.  Perhaps it's because they have to take advantage of everything to make their business pay."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. William Cruse wearing raw silk suit jacket and dress with ribbing and cross straps on bodice, standing in front of store window displaying shoes, man writing in notebook on left
